definition: to sit down
surname Zuo
to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: After sitting down, he is abrupt buccal foam dies.
sentences.chinese: 坐下後，他突然口吐白沫死亡。

sentences.english: The tight shirt rides up out of the trousers when I sit down.
sentences.chinese: 我一坐下這件緊身襯衫就從褲子裏跑到上面來了。

sentences.english: He smiled and touched the ground with his hand, meaning that I should sit down.
sentences.chinese: 他微笑着並用手輕觸着地面，示意我坐下。

sentences.english: When the panels started, I took a lonely seat in the back.
sentences.chinese: 當演講開始時，我獨自在後面找了個座位坐下。

sentences.english: Get many empty seat, everyone orderly and sit down.
sentences.chinese: 上車後還有許多空座位，大家都有序的坐下了。

sentences.english: He seated us and called to his daughter to bring tea.
sentences.chinese: 他讓我們坐下，然後叫他女兒端茶來。

sentences.english: She then confounds me by sitting down to eat the free meal.
sentences.chinese: 她之後坐下喫免費餐食的行爲則讓我困惑。

sentences.english: He could kill and then sit down and eat.
sentences.chinese: 殺人後他仍面不改容立刻坐下喫喝。

sentences.english: I fell back in my chair. The pilgrims fell to their knees.
sentences.chinese: 他把椅子向前拉一些，然後坐下去。

sentences.english: Come sit in your chair, dearie. You're shaking like a leaf.
sentences.chinese: 乖乖，快來坐下，你怕得瑟瑟發抖。

sentences.english: His skis crossed and he sat down in a most undignified manner.
sentences.chinese: 交叉在一起坐下時，姿勢很不雅觀。

sentences.english: They sit down at a table which is covered with snow-white tablecloth.
sentences.chinese: 他們在一張桌旁坐下，桌布雪白。

sentences.english: No sooner was Bahlul seated than he winked at the prince .
sentences.chinese: 巴魯剛一坐下就對王子眨一下眼睛。

sentences.english: He sat down at the side of the road and wrote a telegram to Secretary Stanton.
sentences.chinese: 他迅速下馬，在路邊坐下，給斯坦頓寫了份電報。

sentences.english: Simultaneously, the support object can play the role of protection to the buttocks after people sit down.
sentences.chinese: 同時坐下後稱託物對臀部起到保護作用。

sentences.english: As he sat down, he couldn’t resist another look at the lovely woman.
sentences.chinese: 坐下之後，他禁不住再次看了一眼這位美麗的女士。

definition: to be seated
to sit properly/to sit up straight
to sit down/to take a seat
to sit down
to seat (sb in a restaurant etc)/to take one's seat
to get up/to leave/to set forth
chair/CL:把[ba3],套[tao4]
to stand up
to get up on hind legs (esp. of horse)/to stand/to spring up
surname Zuo
to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]
stool/small seat
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
to squat down/to crouch
to lie down
to call out to/to greet/to say hello to/to inform/to take care of/to take care that one does not
to sit on the ground or the floor (idiom)
